comments.body: q: why one of the "." is gone? Also realize that space after number is important ðŸ˜…

We should only ever emit `..` if the preceding text is an _integer literal_. We do not need to emit `..` if the preceding text is a decimal literal, whitespace, a comment, or anything else. `100/**/..toString()` is not legal JavaScript, so the previous outcome for this test was invalid.
